page.title: 13ECOLOGY
page.content: In one of the squares that we studed there is a large area of derelict land This land is just north of the border between Croydon and Bromley, near Elmers End Station.We found that it used to be the site of a sewage farm. The Land here is very uneven and there are drainage pipes sticking up out of the ground. There are footpaths to follow across the land. In one place there was a group of gipsies. Around this site were lots of bits of old cars. Shortley after our first survey the gipsies moved away. We found lots of plants which were typical of those found on wasteland, beds of nettles, shephered's purse, cow-parsley, hog-weed, charlock and cleavers. We saw red admiral butterflies and a variety of birds;crows, magpies, starlings, blackbirds, and thrushes.
